utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Almost there. You’re doing great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks for lifting my spirits. Next time, try lifting the box.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please hurry.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I don’t need a treadmill.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The doctor says you need to get exercise.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I get plenty of exercise.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Crushing my will to live isn’t exercise.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If she isn’t gonna use it, then why are we doing this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’ll use it. All I need is to rig it with a fishing pole and a HoneyBaked Ham.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right. Now what?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We set it up in Howie’s old room.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you know how to set it up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please, I’m an MIT-trained engineer. I think I can handle… Ma, look out.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Aaaaah! I told you this thing would kill me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So she’s gonna be laid up for at least six weeks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Poor Mrs. Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Should we do something for her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. Let’s go see the new Spider-Man movie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, we’re talking about your friend’s mother. She got hurt.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought that subject had run its course, so I changed it. It’s called reading the room, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, how were things on the set?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, pretty good, actually.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So the movie’s not as bad as you thought?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, it is, but I decided instead of complaining about it, I’m just gonna go in every day and give it my all.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. There’s no reason why I shouldn’t be the best bisexual go-go dancer slowly transforming into a killer gorilla anyone’s ever seen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. The bisexual gorilla go-go dancer in Schindler’s List is tough to beat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, very good. Because a gorilla go-go dancer of any sexual preference would be out of place in a film about the Holocaust.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It only gets funnier when you explain it, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, she’s all settled in the guest room.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe we should get one of those machines to help her up the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean a forklift?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I just can’t deal with this right now.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Taking care of your own mother? How can you say that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie, she’s gonna be off her feet for six to eight weeks. Are you prepared to feed her, wash her and take her to the toilet?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I would do it for my mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, of course you would, you’re a loving person. I’m what my people would call a putz.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look, I’m not crazy about the idea, but what other choice do we have?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We get a nurse. Preferably someone from a third world country who’s used to suffering and unpleasant smells.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’d hire a total stranger to take care of the woman who raised you? That’s so cruel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not if we pay them well and let them listen to the music of their homeland.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I need to tinkle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sounds like a job for a loving person. Would you like me to play some Polish music while you carry her to the toilet?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You are a putz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: As advertised.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks for coming with me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thanks for inviting me after everyone else said no. Aren’t you gonna get 3-D glasses?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I brought my own. No sense in risking bridge-of-nose herpes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that a real thing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, until they invent nose condoms, I’m not finding out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Emily, Hey.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, this is my friend, Sheldon. Sheldon, this is Emily.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes, you’re the dermatologist. I went for a walk yesterday without sunscreen. Do you see anything on my forehead that I should be concerned about?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Um, you know what? I better go. My movie’s about to start.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you here alone?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No, not really.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you mean, not really?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hey, should we get our seats?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Yeah. It was nice seeing you. Um, I’ll call you later.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was awkward, right?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it because she’s dating you but was out with that other fellow?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. I thought she saw something on my forehead.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: And action.

utterance.speaker: Wil Wheaton
utterance.content: Please don’t shut me out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Go away. Just go away.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I swear, I will find a way to turn you back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What gave you the right to mix my DNA with that of a killer gorilla?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I was trying to save your life.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Life? What life? Look at me, I’m a monster. And now I have blood on my hands, or paws. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: You can’t give up. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I love you, too. But I’m afraid I love killing more. Like, one day, I might actually try and kill you.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: And cut. All right. All right, let’s set up for the next scene.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Actually, you know what? Can we do one more? I think I could do it better.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Let’s just move on. No one cares.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I care. I mean, look, if we’re gonna do this, why not try and make it something we’re actually proud of?

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Look, sweetie, this movie is garbage, but you should be happy about that, ’cause if it was a good movie, you wouldn’t be in it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, hang on. There’s no need to insult her.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: And who are you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Isn’t she too hot for you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A little, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Well, boyfriend, get off my set.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You can’t do that. He’s with me.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: You know what? You can get off my set, too. You’re fired.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? You can’t fire me. I’m the star. I’m the girl that goes bananas. It says so on the poster.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Yeah, but we just shot the last scene where we see your face. So from now own, the star of the movie is whoever wears this.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, if you’re gonna fire her, then you have to fire me, too.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Wow, that fell apart really fast.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thanks for skipping the movie. I couldn’t sit in that theatre for two hours wondering about Emily and that guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, quite all right. After my forehead melanoma scare I’ve learned not to sweat the small stuff. Well, sorry, I don’t have all the ingredients to make chai tea.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t have to make me anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I do. You’re upset about Emily and you’re Indian. I need to make you chai tea. Now, I have all the ingredients except cardamom seeds. Do you happen to have any on you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry, I left them in my turban.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll make English breakfast tea. They destroyed your culture. That’s close enough. You know, I’m curious, why are you so upset about seeing Emily with another man?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you be upset if you saw Amy out with someone else?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can’t happen. We have an ironclad relationship agreement which precludes her from physical contact with anyone other than me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But you don’t have sex with her, either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Slick, huh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: To be truthful, Emily and I haven’t dated that long, and we never agreed to be exclusive to each other.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you had intercourse?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, stick to your guns. There will be a lot of pressure.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I’m hungry again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s like the world’s fattest cuckoo clock.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, you’re always talking about having a baby someday. This is exactly what it’s gonna be like.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on. The constant fussing, eating, pooping, burping, drooling. We’re even waiting for the day when she can finally walk on her own.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe you’re right. Anything she finds on the floor goes right in her mouth.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m just telling you now, if we do have kids, don’t expect me to do all the work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I’m a very paternal person. I’d be excellent at taking care of a baby.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I’m still hungry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m coming, you big baby.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, the only thing worse than doing a movie where they glue monkey hair to your ass is getting fired from a movie where they glue monkey hair to your ass.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Forget it, man, it’s crap. You just move on to the next thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it’s easy for you to say. You used to be famous.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey. I just lost a job for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, I’m sorry, you’re famous.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Penny, it’s not about being famous. It’s about the art. It’s about the passion we have for our craft. I have an audition for Sharknado 2. If I book this, I am totally gonna pay you back for this beer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: God, what am I doing with my life?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You having second thoughts about acting?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You were on set, you saw what it was like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s not always that bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about when you did, uh, Anne Frank at that cute little theater?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It was over a bowling alley.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but there was ample parking.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you done?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you were so good in the TV commercial.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It was for haemorrhoid cream.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I got itchy and swollen just watching you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, you are really not cheering me up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on. How can you be sad when you’re going home with all five-foot-six of this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm. You think you’re five-foot-six, that’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t understand it. I’m a nice guy, I have a great job, I’m well-educated, come from a good family. Why don’t women want to be with me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: An interesting question. Well, good night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? Don’t send me home. I can’t be alone right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s your problem. You can’t be alone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How many women have you had dates with?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Eleven.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How many of those women did you think would become your perfect companion?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Eleven. Wait. Do I count the 200-pound Sailor Moon girl that Howard and I had a threesome with at Comic Con?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll stick with eleven. She liked Howard better.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now do you see the problem?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe. I, I don’t know.It’s late, I should, I should go. Look, I do get what you’re saying. Instead of desperately clinging to any woman who will go out with me, I need to work on my fear of being alone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was trying to suggest chemical castration, but it’s my bedtime, so whatever gets you out the door. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, I’m back!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Shh, I just got her to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What took you so long? The grocery store is a few blocks away.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: They only had regular yoghurt. I had to go to a different store to get the extra-fat kind your mom likes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then why do I smell coffee on your breath?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So what? After two days of taking care of her, excuse me for stopping to get a mocha.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A mocha? Well, it must be nice to be queen.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Queen? I’ve been killing myself here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, whose fault is that? I wanted to get a nurse, but you were all, I’m nice, I want to take care of people.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m glad I got that mocha. And you know what else I’m glad about? I bought you a brownie and I ate it in the car.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks a lot. Now I have to go rub her belly again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Thanks for letting me come over.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. Please, come in.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I just wanted to say how sorry I am about tonight, and I want to make sure that we’re okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, look, you and I haven’t made any commitments to each other.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I know. I just felt like I needed to explain. The guy I was with did my last tattoo, and he’s been asking me out for months. I finally said yes just to get it over with.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I mean, yeah, it freaked me out a little, but that’s my issue, not yours.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Wow. If I saw you out with another woman, I’d be pretty upset.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. Not just for being upset, but for believing that could happen.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Just so you know, I’m not seeing anyone else.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, me, neither.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Please. So, uh, you, you have tattoos?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t. I have a hole in my belly button that may or may not have been a piercing.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: That’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a piercing. So, uh, how many tattoos?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: One on my shoulder, one not on my shoulder and one really not on my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s, uh, been a long time since I’ve seen a girl’s really not her shoulder.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well, how about you show me your piercing and I show you my tattoos?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But, uh, before I take my shirt off, I just need like ten minutes to do some crunches.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. What a day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can I get you anything?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I need to start making some smart decisions.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: With your career?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: With my life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. We could get married.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, be serious.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why? Because I’m a, a smart decision?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So I’m like a bran muffin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? No, that’s not what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s exactly what you’re saying. I’m the boring thing you’re choosing because I’m good for you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What does it matter? The point is, I’m choosing you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it matters a lot. I don’t want to be a bran muffin. I, I want to be a Cinnabon, you know? A strawberry Pop-Tart. Something you’re excited about even though it could give you diabetes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, you can be any pastry you want.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no. No, it’s too late. I’m your bran muffin. Probably fat-free and good for your colon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? Forget it. I never should’ve brought it up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know I want to marry you, but you’re only doing this because you got fired and you’re feeling sorry for yourself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, it may look that way, but getting fired from that movie was the best thing that could have happened to me, okay? I finally realize I don’t need to be famous or have some big career to be happy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then what do you need?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You, you stupid Pop-Tart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Then I guess I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? You guess you’re in?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not like, I guess I’m in. Like I guess, I’m in!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Leonard: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So is that it? Are, are we engaged?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not sure. Just feels a little anticlimactic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it kind of does, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I know. This might help.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where did you get a ring?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve had it for a couple years, not important. Penny, will you marry me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This would have been so much more romantic if you didn’t have monkey hair on your finger.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Last night was a little rough, but I think we’re gonna get through this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m proud of us.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Where’s my pancakes?!

utterance.speaker: Foreign Nurse
utterance.content: Coming, Mrs. Wolowitz!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You were right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Welcome to Team Putz.
